title: Jaguars' Little nails would-be-record 70-yard FG
content: Jaguars kicker Cam Little made a 70-yard field goal Saturday in what would have been the longest FG in NFL history had it occurred during the regular season.

title: Lamb, in street garb, trucked by ref, then flagged
content: CeeDee Lamb took a big hit and committed a penalty in the Dallas Cowboys' preseason opener -- even though the star receiver wasn't playing.

title: Titans rookie QB Ward leads TD drive in debut
content: Titans rookie QB Cameron Ward made his preseason debut against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers on Saturday and showed promise in his first live game action.

title: Rivera tears Achilles during Old-Timers' game
content: Mariano Rivera tore an Achilles tendon while going after a fly ball at the New York Yankees' Old-Timers' Day game on Saturday and needs surgery.

title: Moore, out all of '24, hurt on first play for Vikings
content: WR Rondale Moore suffered a "pretty significant" injury to his left knee against the Texans on Saturday, hurting it on his first play after returning from a major injury last season to his right knee.

title: Zilisch breaks collarbone in scary Victory Lane fall
content: NASCAR Xfinity Series points leader Connor Zilisch broke his collarbone after a hard fall in Victory Lane at Watkins Glen International.

title: 2 Japanese boxers die after injuries on same card
content: Japanese boxers Shigetoshi Kotari and Hiromasa Urakawa have died following brain injuries sustained while competing on the same card, although in different fights, at Korakuen Hall in Tokyo on Aug. 2.

title: McCarthy emotional in return from injury 'journey'
content: An emotional J.J. McCarthy took the field for a 13-play stint that cemented his return from a yearlong injury absence as the Vikings topped the Texans 20-10 on Saturday.

title: üî• Brewers' Misiorowski pulls rare Pok√©mon card
content: The Milwaukee Brewers' vibes were high when they pulled a rare Pok√©mon card after extending their win streak to seven.

title: 'I want it to be my life': Why Patrick Mahomes is much more than a celebrity product endorser
content: For an active athlete of his stature, the Chiefs QB has been unusually involved in his coffee brand's coast-to-coast growth.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: Do the Cubs have a championship-level roster? Here's what MLB insiders think
content: After a trade deadline that was more mild than wild, we asked around the sport to see if the Cubs have enough to win big.

title: How the Indiana Fever adjust to season-ending injuries to Colson, McDonald
content: With Caitlin Clark out, the backcourt was already depleted. How will losing two guards impact the Fever's playoff race?

title: Caitlin Clark and 13 more impact WNBA players for playoff (or future) success
content: The margin for error is shrinking as the playoffs approach. Who will be the difference-makers for their teams?

title: Sesko signs: How Man United won the race and how he'll fit in Amorim's plans
content: Benjamin Sesko has completed his blockbuster move to Man United: How he plays, how he'll fit in Ruben Amorim's plans

title: Can Wrexham's Hollywood fairy tale continue, or is rude awakening ahead?
content: Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac have their sights on the EPL -- but the closer they get, the more unrealistic it is.

title: üèà Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: üèÜ Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: üèÄ Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: üèà ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üßÇ 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: üëä Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Does NFL success and fame translate to college football success? These schools are betting it does
content: With high expectations for this new wave of celebrity coaches that includes Eddie George, reputation can take these leaders only so far.

title: 'I'm made for it': Austin Simmons gets his shot at Ole Miss
content: At 19, the two-sport star has already graduated from Ole Miss, but he's getting his first chance to start at QB.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle tell Isak he can't leave to join Liverpool
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak has been told he cannot leave the club for Liverpool this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: Para-Athlete Among 2 Dead After Being Bitten By Rabid Dog In Odisha
content: The dog reportedly went on a biting spree in Bolangir on July 23, attacking six people, including some students who were on the way to school.

title: PM Modi Launches Bengaluru Metro's Yellow Line, New Vande Bharat Express
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated the much-awaited "Yellow Line" of Bangalore Metro Rail, which is expected to ease traffic congestion in several heavily congested corridors connecting the city's IT hub.

title: Glue Addiction Taken Tragic Turn, Man Kills Grandma, Parents Critical
content: A tragic incident linked to adhesive addiction has emerged from Maharashtra. A man under the influence of the chemical attacked his parents and grandmother with a knife for being refused money, apparently to fund his addiction in Parli city of Beed.

title: Tejashwi Yadav Says Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Has 2 Voter IDs. He Replies
content: Adding a twist to the row over Bihar's voter list revision, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has claimed that Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Vijay Kumar Sinha holds two EPIC cards

title: Nvidia CEO Reviews Salaries Of All 42,000 Employees Every Month. Here's Why It Works
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says he reviews the salaries of all 42,000 employees every month, a practice he calls central to his management style.

title: "Perfect Time To...": Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Fallon Slam Trump's India Tariffs
content: Late-night show hosts Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Fallon have slammed US President Donald Trump for imposing a 50 per cent tariff on India.

title: Ex-Boyfriend Charged With Abetment To Suicide After Odisha Student's Death
content: The police have booked the ex-boyfriend of the 19-year-old woman college student whose charred body was found in her house in Kendrapara district, on charge of abetment of suicide and sexual harassment, an officer said on Sunday.

title: OpenAI Announces Quarterly Bonuses To 1,000 Employees Amid GPT-5 Rollout
content: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has announced massive bonus payouts for about 1,000 employees, which is approximately one-third of its full-time workforce.

title: College Fresher Assaulted, Given Electric Shock In Andhra Ragging Horror
content: A first-year intermediate student of a government college in Andhra Pradesh's Palnadu district was allegedly ragged, assaulted and administered electric shocks by a group of seniors recently.

title: How Namma Metro's Yellow Line Will Benefit People Of Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru had a major transport upgrade today as Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the long-awaited Yellow Line of Namma Metro, which links RV Road in South Bengaluru to Bommasandra in the east.

title: Kerala Man, Arrested Over Wife's Death By Suicide In UAE, Released On Bail
content: A month after the death of Chavara native Athulya Shekhar (29) in Sharjah, Kerala Police on Sunday detained her husband Satheesh (40), the sole accused in the case, at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport.

title: UP Woman Jumps Into Canal With 3 Children, Bodies Found Tied Together
content: A woman and her three children died after she jumped into a canal with them, allegedly after a fight with her husband in Uttar Pradesh.

title: 600 Kilometres In 18 Hours: First Freight Train Reaches Kashmir's Anantnag
content: The first freight train arrived in the Kashmir Valley on Saturday as the Northern Railway opened its Anantnag goods shed under its larger Udhampur-Srinagar"-Baramulla Rail Link (USBRL) project for the movement of goods, officials said.

title: Pedestrian Dies After Speeding Thar Hits Him, Driver Says He Had Dozed Off
content: A pedestrian has died after a speeding Thar hit him in New Delhi's high-security diplomatic enclave, Chanakyapuri. The accident occurred about two kilometres from Rashtrapati Bhavan

title: Encounter Breaks Out In J&K's Kishtwar Between Terrorists, Security Forces
content: An encounter broke out between terrorists and security forces in Kishtwar district of Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday, officials said.

title: Harsh Goenka Lauds Satya Nadella's Reply To Elon Musk's Swipe Over GPT-5
content: Industrialist Harsh Goenka has lauded Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's "mature" handling of a public swipe from Elon Musk, calling it a "masterclass" as it turned criticism into a celebration of learning.

title: "Heard Of Laapataa Ladies But..." Kapil Sibal Questions J Dhankhar's Whereabouts
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal on Saturday said he had heard of the movie "Laapataa Ladies" but never of a "laapataa (absent) vice president," as he raised questions about the whereabouts of former VP Jagdeep Dhankhar.

title: In Just 6 Months, This App Helped Recover Lakhs Of Stolen Phones
content: More than 5.35 lakh lost or stolen mobile phones have been recovered across India, thanks to the Sanchar Saathi initiative of the Department of Telecommunications (DoT).

title: Chinese Diplomat, Seen As Potential Foreign Minister, Being Probed: Report
content: Liu Jianchao, a senior Chinese diplomat widely seen as a potential foreign minister, has been taken away by authorities for questioning, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.

title: Army Chief Shares How Forces Reacted To Pahalgam, What Rajnath Singh Said
content: Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi has narrated the turn of events that followed the ghastly terror attack in Pahalgam, which culminated in the 'Operation Sindoor' mega military offensive in May.

title: 'There's some boss who ...': Rajnath mocks Trump's attempt to damage India's economy
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticized the US President's tariff hikes on Indian imports, suggesting that some global powers are attempting to hinder India's economic progress due to jealousy over its rapid growth. Despite these challenges, Singh asserted India's unstoppable rise as a major global power, highlighting the country's increasing defence exports as a sign of resilience and strength.

title: UP horror: Woman chops off husband‚Äôs genitals after quarrel in Amethi; held
content: In Fasanganj Kachnaw village, a domestic dispute escalated when Nazneen Bano allegedly attacked her husband, Ansar Ahmad, with a knife, severing his genitals during a heated argument. Ahmad, who had two wives and no children, was rushed to AIIMS Raebareli for treatment. Police have taken Nazneen into custody for interrogation following the violent incident.

title: 'Why now?' In Op Sindoor revelations, Cong sees bid to divert from 'vote theft' row
content: Congress leaders are questioning the timing of Air Chief Marshal AP Singh's disclosure about Pakistan's losses during Operation Sindoor. Udit Raj linked the revelation to the ongoing ‚Äúvote theft‚Äù controversy, while Imran Masood suggested it's a tactic to divert attention from allegations against the Election Commission.

title: SIR row: Tejashwi claims Bihar deputy CM has 2 EPIC numbers; his 'jungle raj prince' retort
content: Tejashwi Yadav accused Bihar's Deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha of voter fraud, claiming Sinha is registered in two constituencies with different ages and EPIC numbers. Yadav questioned the Election Commission's role, alleging possible forged signatures and deliberate facilitation of duplicate registrations for BJP supporters. The Election Commission refuted Yadav's claims, deeming the presented EPIC as fake and demanding its submission.

title: VP election: INDIA bloc to field joint candidate; Kharge reaches out to allies
content: The INDIA bloc is set to field a joint candidate for the upcoming vice-presidential election, aiming to send a strong political message. Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge is engaging with allies to build consensus on potential nominees. This move follows a recent show of unity among opposition parties, including discussions on voter list manipulation led by Rahul Gandhi.

title: ‚ÄòPeople are going to walk in the door &‚Ä¶‚Äô: PwC AI assurance leader on junior hires
content: PwC is reshaping its training programs as AI transforms the accounting industry. Junior accountants will quickly assume manager-level responsibilities, overseeing AI systems that handle routine tasks. The firm is emphasizing fundamental audit principles, critical thinking, and advanced analytical skills for new hires to adapt to the evolving landscape.

title: 'Limit to lying': Rijiju slams Rahul over Op Sindoor remarks, cites IAF chief rebuttal
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's allegations regarding Operation Sindoor, BJP leaders have strongly criticized the Congress MP for echoing a Pakistani narrative and undermining the armed forces. Kiren Rijiju and Amit Malviya shared IAF Chief AP Singh's remarks, emphasizing the government's clear political will and the freedom granted to the forces during the operation.

title: Senior Chinese diplomat detained: Was seen as next foreign minister - report
content: Senior Chinese diplomat Liu Jianchao, a potential future foreign minister, has been detained for questioning, raising concerns within the Communist Party. Liu, who heads the international department, was reportedly taken into custody after returning from an overseas trip. The reasons for his detention remain unclear, marking a high-level inquiry since the removal of former foreign minister Qin Gang.

title: FASTag Annual Pass to go live on August 15: Fee, validity, number of trips allowed & other details
content: India's FASTag system is getting an upgrade. The National Highways Authority of India will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on Independence Day. This pass costs Rs 3,000. It allows up to 200 toll crossings or a year of travel for private vehicles. The goal is to reduce congestion and speed up toll transactions.

title: Lion's share: India's big cats roar to record 891; 32% jump in five years
content: India's Asiatic lion population has seen a remarkable increase, surging by 32.2% from 674 in 2020 to 891 in 2025. This growth, highlighted in the 16th Lion Population Estimation report, includes expansion into new satellite areas and corridor regions. The rise in adult females by nearly 27% significantly boosts the species' reproductive capacity, marking a major success in conservation efforts.

title: Watch: PM Modi launches 3 Vande Bharat Express trains, Bengaluru Metro's yellow line
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated three Vande Bharat Express trains from Bengaluru, connecting Bengaluru to Belagavi, Amritsar to Sri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra, and Nagpur to Pune. He toured the Vande Bharat Express, interacting with schoolchildren. Additionally, PM Modi inaugurated Bangalore Metro's Yellow Line, expanding the city's metro network. He also laid the foundation stone for Bangalore Metro Phase 3.

title: Boy's 150km trek with severed arm exposes bonded labour, rescued in Haryana
content: A 15-year-old bonded labour survivor from Bihar is recovering in Haryana after a horrific ordeal. He was found walking along a road with a severed arm, narrating a tale of being lured with a job promise, then held captive at a dairy farm where he lost his arm in an accident.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: 'Will obviously surpass MS Dhoni': Former India cricketer hails Rishabh Pant, claims England will soon build his statues
content: Aakash Chopra predicts Rishabh Pant will surpass MS Dhoni's Test run record if he maintains his form and gets to play regularly. Despite being currently sidelined, Pant has already scored 3427 runs in 47 Tests, including eight centuries, surpassing Dhoni's six. Chopra highlights Pant's exceptional performance in England, where he has amassed over 1000 runs, suggesting he could become India's greatest wicketkeeper-batter.

title: Ignored villagers‚Äô warning: UP man heading home for Rakhi swept away
content: In a tragic incident in Bijnor, a 35-year-old man drowned after being swept away by strong currents on a flooded road. Neetu Singh, who had come from Haryana for Rakshabandhan, was returning from Sahaspur when he attempted to cross the waterlogged stretch near Jairampur village, ignoring warnings from locals.

title: 'My mistake': Rohit‚Äôs childhood coach shares how he discovered the batter inside him
content: Rohit Sharma's journey to becoming a destructive opener almost took a different turn. His childhood coach, Dinesh Lad, initially saw him as a promising off-spinner. Lad discovered Rohit's batting talent by chance when he saw him batting in school. Impressed by his skills, Lad promoted him to open, where he scored 140 runs.

title: College student assaulted by seniors in Andhra, attackers tried to give electric shock
content: In Palnadu district, a first-year intermediate student at a BC hostel in Dachepalli was brutally assaulted by senior students. The disturbing incident, filmed and circulated on social media, prompted police action. Authorities have arrested three of the five accused involved in the attack, which included kicking and attempted electric shock.

title: 21-year-old from Chhattisgarh gets surprise calls from Kohli and AB de Villiers ‚Äì how it happened
content: In Chhattisgarh, Manish Bisi was accidentally given cricketer Rajat Patidar‚Äôs old number, leading to calls from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers. Mistaken for Patidar, he thought it was a prank until police intervened and returned the SIM. The 21-year-old called the experience unforgettable and shared that he hopes to meet Patidar.

title: Chess | Praggnanandhaa decodes Magnus Carlsen's greatness - 'He‚Äôs just universally strong'
content: R Praggnanandhaa, who has challenged Magnus Carlsen, shared insights into the World No. 1's greatness, highlighting Carlsen's exceptional intuition and ability to consistently make optimal moves. Praggnanandhaa emphasized Carlsen's mental fortitude, noting his relentless fighting spirit and resourcefulness in every game.

title: Human trafficking network busted: Girl sold twice for marriage rescued in Rajasthan
content: The CBI rescued a minor girl from Pali, Rajasthan, nearly two years after she disappeared from West Bengal, suspecting a human trafficking network. The Calcutta High Court transferred the case to the CBI after local efforts failed.

title: CBSE to introduce open-book exams: Class 9 rollout from 2026-27
content: The CBSE has approved the introduction of open-book assessments for Class 9 students from the 2026-27 academic session. The decision follows a successful pilot study and aligns with the NEP 2020 and NCFSE 2023, aiming to shift from rote memorisation to application-based learning. These assessments will be part of internal exams in core subjects. A similar model, OTBA, was previously introduced in 2014 but discontinued in 2017-18 due to limited impact on critical thinking.

title: ‚ÄòRM said enough is enough‚Äô: Army chief recalls day after Pahalgam attack
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi shared details about Operation Sindoor. It followed the Pahalgam attack. The government gave the army a free hand. Indian forces struck terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. Air Chief Marshal AP Singh revealed the destruction of Pakistani assets. He credited the government's clear political will. The operation galvanised the nation.

title: 'To enhance its reputation‚Äô: Bangladesh hires ex-ICC anti-corruption head
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has appointed Alex Marshall, the former head of the ICC‚Äôs Anti-Corruption Unit, as a consultant for one year to strengthen its anti-corruption efforts. This decision comes in response to numerous corruption complaints and aims to enhance vigilance and training within the BCB's ACU.

title: Swifties celebrate Gardner-Johnson‚Äôs injury; months after vulgar jab
content: C.J. Gardner-Johnson faced a social media backlash. This followed his leg injury during practice. The injury occurred after his Super Bowl remarks about Taylor Swift. Swifties recalled his comments. They linked the injury to karma. Some fans wished him well. Others referenced Swift's songs. The incident revived discussions about his past behavior. It also highlighted fan reactions to celebrity interactions.

title: Delhi shocker: One dead after speeding Thar hits man; liquor bottle found in vehicle
content: A tragic accident near 11 Murti on Mother Teresa Road in New Delhi claimed one life and left another person injured. Delhi Police confirmed that a vehicle struck two individuals, leading to the fatality. The driver has been detained, and authorities discovered a liquor bottle inside the car.

title: RCB captain‚Äôs old SIM lands with Chhattisgarh youth, answers calls from Virat Kohli
content: A youth in Gariaband received Rajat Patidar's re-allotted mobile number. He then started getting calls from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers. The youth initially thought it was a prank. Patidar contacted the Madhya Pradesh Cyber Cell when he could not access his number. Police recovered the SIM and returned it to Patidar. The cricket fans called the incident unforgettable.

title: ‚ÄòLost love‚Äô scam: Mumbai cops nab Rajasthan duo over promise to reunite lovers
content: Mumbai police busted two fraudsters from Rajasthan who exploited vulnerable individuals seeking love reunions through an online scam. Posing as spiritual gurus, they convinced a South Mumbai woman's daughter to pay for rituals with gold and cash. The crime branch traced the suspects to Sri Ganganagar, recovering stolen property worth Rs 16.2 lakh.

title: 'RR has meant the world to me': Samson breaks silence amid IPL trade rumours
content: Sanju Samson expressed deep gratitude for Rajasthan Royals amid speculation about his future with the franchise. Recalling his early days, Samson credited RR for providing him a platform and unwavering support. Despite leading the team to the 2022 final, IPL 2025 posed challenges as he missed matches due to injury.

title: 'Voter fraud', SIR row: Kharge to host dinner for INDIA bloc MPs; what's on agenda?
content: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge is set to host a dinner for INDIA bloc MPs amidst escalating concerns over alleged electoral roll manipulation in Bihar and accusations of poll rigging. This gathering, coinciding with a protest march to the Election Commission, underscores the opposition's united front against perceived threats to democracy and electoral integrity.

title: PM inaugurates B'luru metro project: Route, cost & more‚Äî 10 things to know
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate Bengaluru's Yellow Line metro, a 19-km stretch connecting RV Road to Bommasandra, significantly expanding the city's metro network. This addition will make Bengaluru's metro the second-longest in India, enhancing connectivity to key residential, industrial, and tech areas.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Thank you sir' - Mohammed Siraj pens emotional response to Sachin Tendulkar
content: Mohammed Siraj's match-winning performances in England, where he took 23 wickets in the series, earned him high praise from Sachin Tendulkar. Tendulkar lauded Siraj's relentless attitude and intensity, stating that even Joe Root wouldn't enjoy facing him. Siraj responded with gratitude. Shubman Gill also praised Siraj's unwavering spirit, highlighting his crucial role in India's thrilling series-levelling victory.

title: Man carries pistol to threaten sister‚Äôs husband on Raksha Bandhan, held
content: On Rakshabandhan, Ahmedabad police arrested a 23-year-old man, Bharwad, for allegedly planning to confront his brother-in-law with a country-made pistol and eight cartridges. He was enraged by his sister's interfaith marriage without the family's consent, viewing it as a dishonor. Police intercepted him based on a tip-off, recovering the weapon and ammunition, and are investigating the source of the firearm.

title: 'She bewitched me‚Äô: Tamil Nadu man kills ex-wife, buries body in forest; arrested
content: In a shocking incident, Madan, a 42-year-old car driver, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his former wife, Laila Kumari, in Tiruvallur. Madan confessed to slitting her throat and burying her in a forest after suspecting she had bewitched him. Following a missing person report filed by Laila's mother, Madan surrendered to the police.

title: Wobble Trouble! The mystery ball behind Siraj‚Äôs success against England
content: Mohammed Siraj's mastery of the wobble seam ball proved pivotal in India's recent Test series against England, where he emerged as the leading wicket-taker with 23 wickets. This unpredictable delivery, which moves both ways off the pitch, kept batters guessing. Siraj, along with Akash Deep and Prasidh Krishna, effectively utilised it.

title: Cops on lookout for fake doctor who ran clinic for 10yrs; gave patients steroid shots
content: Following an anonymous tip, Bengaluru police are searching for Munendrachari K, who allegedly operated a fraudulent medical clinic in Doddakannahalli for a decade. Posing as a family physician, he prescribed allopathic medicines and steroid injections, despite claiming to be an Ayurvedic doctor. Investigations revealed a fake registration certificate, leading to the clinic's closure and a police complaint.

title: 705 deaths in 10 yrs: Flash floods a major killer in U'khand
content: Uttarakhand faces a deadly pattern of natural disasters. Flash floods and landslides killed hundreds in the last decade. Data shows nearly 3,500 people died in natural disasters. Studies flag Uttarakhand as a hotspot for extreme weather events. Experts call for urgent action. This includes climate-resilient infrastructure and early warning systems. Unchecked development in hazard-prone zones must stop.

title: Army troops launch anti-terror operation in Kishtwar; gunfire exchanged
content: In the Kishtwar region of Jammu and Kashmir, a gunfight erupted between security forces and terrorists on Sunday. Indian Army troops, acting on intelligence, made contact with the terrorists in the Dul area early on August 10. An exchange of gunfire ensued, and the operation is currently ongoing as security forces work to neutralize the threat.

title: Pakistan lost Rs 127cr in 2 months after closing airspace for India, says report
content: Pakistan Airports Authority faced a revenue loss of approximately Rs 123 crore after closing its airspace to Indian-registered aircraft between April 24 and June 30, according to Dawn. This action, following India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, impacted numerous Indian flights daily. A similar closure in 2019 had previously cost Pakistan an estimated Rs 228 crore.

title: Chess | Beating Carlsen! Pragg reveals ‚Äòone-word‚Äô reaction from his father after win
content: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa recounted his father's understated reaction to his first victory over World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen in 2022. Despite the 2 a.m. win at the Champions Chess Tour, his father simply said 'Good' before returning to sleep.

title: 'If you ask a Pakistani ...': Army chief mocks Pak victory claim
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi criticized Pakistan's claims of victory in the May clashes following Operation Sindoor, highlighting the importance of narrative management in war. He emphasized that the Centre granted the armed forces a "free hand" to execute Operation Sindoor after the Pahalgam attack.

title: Leopard mauls 3-year-old to death in Nashik, sister ties rakhi before cremation
content: A tragic incident occurred near Nashik. Ayush Bhagat, a three-year-old boy, was killed in a leopard attack. The incident took place near his home. Family members and villagers searched for him after he went missing. Forest personnel used thermal drone cameras in the search. Ayush's body was found in a sugarcane field with severe injuries.

title: ‚Çπ5.41 lakh! Shubman Gill's signed jersey fetches massive sum in auction; Pant's cap goes for over a lakh
content: Shubman Gill's signed India Test jersey from Lord's fetched ‚Çπ5.41 lakh at auction, topping Red For Ruth charity sales. The auction included memorabilia from Indian and English players. Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja's jerseys secured ‚Çπ4.94 lakh each, while Rishabh Pant's cap reached ‚Çπ1.76 lakh. Joe Root's cap was popular at ‚Çπ3.52 lakh.

title: IndiGo fined Rs 1.5L over dirty seats, passenger's mental agony
content: IndiGo Airlines has been held liable by the District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission in New Delhi for providing unhygienic and stained seats on a flight from Baku to Delhi. The commission found this to be a deficiency in service, violating consumer expectations. Consequently, the airline has been directed to pay a compensation of Rs 1.

title: Evolution of Prasidh Krishna: Impressed at The Oval, but real test awaits at home
content: Prasidh Krishna's impressive eight-wicket haul at The Oval marked a potential turning point in his career, showcasing his adaptability and mental fortitude. Despite initial struggles with his length in the series, he adjusted his approach to secure a crucial win for India.

title: Orioles dealing with injuries; Rockies shut down Estrada
content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the slate opens with the first game of a separate admission doubleheader as the Atlanta Braves host the Miami Marlins . Logan Henderson was placed on the 15-day IL with a right elbow flexor strain .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Travis Hunter sees action at WR and CB in Jaguars debut
content: the 2025 preseason kicks off with several rookies playing their first snaps . rookies and offseason acquisitions make the biggest impact in their first game action . the rookies made a big hit and a pass breakup on the first drive .

title: Ultimate Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet: Print. Draft. Win
content: the ultimate ESPN fantasy football cheat sheet is a curated rundown of all the names we've been talking about this preseason . if you want to read more about sleepers, busts, rookies, backups, value picks and more, the analysis is available for you to pore through .

title: Prepare for ‚Äòtheaters of war‚Äô: IDF trains for large-scale attacks; launches exercise ‚ÄòDawn‚Äô
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Power Rankings: Who's the best team in baseball right now?
content: the Phillies sit at no. 1 for the third consecutive week . the Yankees have dropped five straight games since July 31 . they have fallen to their lowest ranking of the season at No. 12 . but the red sox have won seven of their last eight games .

title: NBA's new financial rules threaten dynasties: 'Harder choices' for top teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . since the Warriors won back-to-back titles in 2017 and 2018, the NBA has seen seven different champions hoist the Larry O'Brien Trophy . there have been 11 different finalists in each of the past six postseasons .

title: Opposition parties satirise Suresh Gopi‚Äôs ‚Äòabsenteeism‚Äô from his constituency; KSU files missing person complaint
content: General Education Minister and Communist Party of India (Marxist) [CPI(M)] State committee member V. Sivankutty wrote on Facebook: ‚ÄúPosters are appearing in Thrissur for a missing person‚Äù

title: Senior Advocates not permitted to mention cases before CJI's Court from August 11
content: On August 6, the CJI had said that from August 11, no Senior Advocate will be permitted to mention cases for urgent listing and hearing in his court so that juniors get an opportunity to do it

title: Election Commission delists 23 registered unrecognised political parties in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry
content: The ECI had, in June, issued notices to 24 registered unrecognised political parties in Tamil Nadu as to why they should not be delisted, since they have not contested any election.

title: Panneerselvam wants Thirumavalavan to withdraw¬†remarks¬†on MGR, Jayalalithaa
content: Mr. Thirumavalavan should think if it was appropriate to criticise Amma (Jayalalithaa) on her caste, the former coordinator of AIADMK said

title: Police detain Ambedkar Okkuta members planning a protest demanding renaming of Bengaluru‚Äôs Ragigudda metro station
content: The area where the station has been constructed is situated in Marenahalli and not Ragigudda which is around half a kilometre away from the station.

title: Akhilesh Yadav accuses BJP of 'electoral corruption'
content: Akhilesh Yadav alleged that the BJP, with the connivance of some officials, manipulates voter lists by adding fake voters who support it and deleting names of opposition supporters

title: D.K. Shivakumar says Centre contributing only 20% to Bengaluru Metro Yellow Line
content: Comparing tax allocations, D.K. Shivakumar pointed out that Ahmedabad receives a 20% share, while Bengaluru gets only 10%. ‚ÄúWe should be treated like other major cities and considered alongside the national capital,‚Äù he said, adding that his appeal was non-political

title: India world‚Äôs most ‚Äòdashing and dynamic‚Äô economy, some people not liking it: Rajnath
content: Rajnath Singh‚Äôs comments come amid high tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump on goods imported from India

title: Pedestrian killed, another hurt as SUV rams into pavement near Gyarah Murti in Delhi
content: The incident took place when a white Mahindra Thar coming from the direction of central Delhi swerved towards the pavement and struck the two men, police said

title: Priyank Kharge accuses BJP of ‚Äòhijacking‚Äô credit for Yellow Line
content: According to Karnataka Rural Development Minister, after BJP came to power, their commitment to the project dwindled, with the Central Government‚Äôs share decreasing drastically in subsequent phases

title: PM Modi inaugurates long-delayed Yellow Line of Bengaluru Metro, flags off Vande Bharat to Belagavi
content: An official said the train carrying PM Modi would be operated by a woman loco pilot; school children will also be on board and Mr. Modi is expected to interact with them, the official said

title: PM Modi to inaugurate newly-constructed flats for MPs in New Delhi
content: The development of the project was necessitated due to shortage of adequate housing for Members of Parliament

title: Police book woman student's ex-boyfriend for her death
content: Pramod Behera was booked after the victim's father lodged a written complaint at the police station on Saturday (August 9, 2025), naming him as the prime accused

title: ‚ÄòDrone thieves‚Äô trigger panic, night patrols across villages in western Uttar Pradesh
content: According to police, the roots of this hysteria lie in Amroha, where bizarre rumours began circulating in early June about an underwear-clad, oil-smeared gang of thieves using drones to survey homes before burglaries

title: Watch: Thackeray vs Shinde: Delhi trips, political gambits and party storms
content: Why were Uddhav Thackeray and Eknath Shinde in Delhi this week? How will the possibility of Raj-Uddhav‚Äôs alliance affect the INDIA bloc? In this episode of Pulse Maharashtra, we give context to the top news from Maharashtra this week.

title: Tejashwi Yadav claims Bihar Deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha has two EPIC numbers
content: Tejashwi Yadav further asked the ECI and the district administrations of Patna and Lakhisarai, what kind of action would be taken against him, highlighting the ECI‚Äôs swiftness in issuing him a notice.

title: Farmers in Maharashtra¬†to hoist tricolour in fields on Independence Day to protest Shaktipeeth Expressway
content: Congress MLC Satej Patil said the protest move symbolises farmers‚Äô demand for ‚Äúfreedom‚Äù from the project

title: Private bus goes up in flames on NH 966 near Calicut International Airport
content: The incident took place around 9 a.m. between Kolathur and Thurakkal and according to the bus driver, a short circuit likely caused the fire

title: Unhygienic, dirty, stained seat to passenger: Delhi consumer forum tells Indigo Airlines to pay ‚Çπ1.5 lakh compensation
content: The New Delhi District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission was hearing a complaint filed by Pinki, alleging that she was provided an ‚Äúunhygienic, dirty and stained‚Äù seat while she was travelling from Baku to New Delhi on January 2 this year

title: Heard of Laapataa Ladies not of laapataa V-P: Kapil Sibal on Dhankhar's no-show since resignation
content: Sibal urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to make a statement on the whereabouts of Dhankhar to assuage his concerns about his health and well-being

title: Congress launches campaign urging people to ‚Äòregister‚Äô against ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô
content: Anyone can click on the portal link and download "vote chori proof, demand EC accountability and report vote chori"

title: Bailey bridge construction nears completion to restore connectivity in flood-hit Uttarkashi: Officials
content: The search for the missing in the flood-ravaged Dharali also continued, with the help of SDRF sniffer dogs and equipment such as victim locating and thermal imaging cameras.

title: Go to court or ECI if you have proof: Shinde on Rahul Gandhi's 'vote theft' allegations
content: Rahul Gandhi had alleged that the Maharashtra assembly poll results (last year) confirmed the Congress‚Äôs suspicion that the election was ‚Äòstolen‚Äô

title: Law does not require sharing details of persons not included in draft electoral roll: ECI tells Supreme Court
content: No such list can be sought as a matter of right; Political parties were supplied with an updated list of names of electors not included in the draft roll to reach out to these individuals and ensure no eligible elector is left out: ECI

title: Modi in Bengaluru: Indian tech and Make In India behind Operation Sindoor‚Äôs success | LIVE
content: Mr. Modi also flagged off three Vande Bharat Express trains in Bengaluru, including the KSR Bengaluru‚ÄìBelagavi service, the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Katra‚ÄìAmritsar service, and the Nagpur (Ajni)‚ÄìPune service.

title: In frames | Sweet sorrow
content: Palmyra climbers in Thoothukudi in Tamil Nadu toil hard to collect pathaneer , the syrupy raw material for palm jaggery, but their numbers are dwindling day by day

title: Encounter breaks out between security forces, terrorists in J&K's Kishtwar
content: The security forces had launched a search operation in Dool area of the hilly district following specific information about the presence of terrorists, officials said

title: Applications invited for vacant seats for free education in private schools in Andhra Pradesh
content: Online applications can be submitted from August 12 to 20, while verification of eligibility will be done on August 21; Lottery results will be declared on August 25

title: The warped weft: the plight of handloom industry in Tamil Nadu
content: While a handloom woven sari can fetch 10 times the rate of a mass, machine produced one, the hard truth is that the number of handloom weavers is declining; their wages remain low, and several traditional skills in the handweaving process have almost been lost. M. Soundariya Preetha dives deep to find out more

title: Coimbatore Corporation awaits ‚Çπ23 crore State Government funds for streetlight installation and replacement
content: A Corporation official stated, ‚ÄúWe are awaiting the allocation of funds from the State government. Once the funding is approved, we will commence the installation work without delay.‚Äù

title: What happens to ‚Äòmissing names‚Äô on Bihar SIR list? | Explained
content: What is the next phase in the special intensive revision of electoral rolls? When will the final list be released?

title: Will India cave in to U.S. pressure on Russian oil? | Explained
content: Why has President Donald Trump announced penalty tariffs on India? When does it come into effect? Is a rapprochement possible before the deadline? How much oil does India import from Russia? Has India begun reducing oil buys from Russia and importing more from other countries?

title: Police official deployed in Ashok Gehlot‚Äôs security arrested in paper leak case
content: Mr. Yadav allegedly obtained the paper illegally through a source and provided it to his son Bharat Yadav.

title: Rajasthan BJP spokesperson expelled over controversial remarks
content: BJP expels Krishan Kumar Janu for six years after he questions the party‚Äôs stand on ex-J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik and former Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar

title: First freight train chugs into Kashmir Valley, raises hopes of fruit traders
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi described the feat as a ‚Äúgreat day for commerce and connectivity in J&K‚Äù. ‚ÄúIt will enhance both progress and prosperity,‚Äù he posted on X.

title: Telangana to instal solar plants in all govt. offices
content: Mr. Vikramarka asked the authorities to send plans of all Integrated Collectorate complexes to the Telangana Renewable Energy Development Corporation Ltd

title: PMK holds general body meet without Ramadoss; Anbumani to continue as president for one year
content: For the first time, the general body meeting was held without PMK founder S. Ramadoss, amid the ongoing stand-off with his son Dr. Anbumani

title: Bengalureans overcome with ‚Äònostalgia‚Äô as India Post discontinues Registered Post, one of its oldest services
content: Registered Post, one of the oldest services of India Post, has long been a reliable source of communication related to court, governance, submission of college applications, personal letters, etc. due to its addressee-specific delivery system

title: SEP Commission opposes foreign universities setting up campuses in Karnataka¬†
content: State Education Policy (SEP) Commission chairman Sukhadeo Thorat told The Hindu that the commission in its report submitted to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday, had opposed allowing foreign universities directly setting up their campuses in Karnataka.¬†

title: No name will be deleted without notice, says ECI on Bihar SIR
content: The poll body told the Supreme Court that it would adhere to the principles of natural justice by giving voters facing deletion a ‚Äúreasonable opportunity of being heard and furnishing relevant documents‚Äù

title: ECI again asks Rahul Gandhi to submit evidence of irregularity in Karnataka Assembly election under oath
content: The Congress leader has claimed 1,00,250 ‚Äòfake votes‚Äô were created in the Mahadevapura Assembly seat in Bengaluru to ensure a win for the BJP

title: In Gurez Valley, a lone man is archiving the Dard-Shin story
content: For the past three years, Basheer Ahmad Teroo has been collecting vestiges of his community‚Äôs culture ‚Äì items that he has begun storing and displaying at his home in Dawar town

title: Why Maoists are on the wane in the once-dreaded Red Corridor
content: Maoists prioritised military preparedness and ideological indoctrination over any tangible development in the regions they controlled, and the very communities which they claimed to be championing suffered

title: Kerala marks golden jubilee of State Scheduled Tribes Development department
content: A separate department was formed for the welfare of tribal communities in the State 50 years ago, the Chief Minister says

title: Political parties say they have filed many claims and objections after Bihar draft roll, though ECI lists zero complaints
content: Opposition party BLAs say they have filed multiple complaints on plain paper, counter-signed by poll officials; ECI is allegedly pushing those deleted from draft rolls to instead fill Form 6, meant for new voters

title: Four years late, Bengaluru metro‚Äôs Yellow Line ready to roll
content: The project was initially scheduled for completion by December 2021 but was plagued by a series of setbacks, including delays in land acquisition, the COVID-19 pandemic, and hold-ups in rolling stock supply from the Chinese manufacturer CRRC Nanjing

title: Four Bangladeshi men held after armed robbery attempt in Meghalaya
content: The incident happened at a border village in the South West Khasi Hills district; Police, BSF launch search for five others from cross-border gang

title: ‚ÄòUntouchability wall‚Äô in Karur torn down after T.N. revenue officials, police intervene
content: Members of the intermediate caste initially refused to tear down the wall claiming that the wall was meant to prevent anti-social activities by ‚Äòoutsiders‚Äô under the influence of alcohol. The Arunthathiyar community alleged the wall was raised to prevent access to areas where the caste Hindus lived

title: SEP recommends reservation in admissions for SC/STs, OBC students in private colleges and universities
content: ‚ÄúAround 60% of the universities and colleges are private or unaided, and 72% of the students are studying in these institutions,‚Äù he said, adding that the fees at these private institutions were high, acting as a barrier to many students.
